marketNews.title: Important Notes on the 2025 State Budget Financial Notes
marketNews.content: The Ministry of Finance held a press conference regarding the 2025 State Budget Financial Notes on Friday (16/8). Here are some important notes from us: - Subsidy Budget Increased, Positive for Consumption: The budget for energy subsidies and compensation increased by +18% to 394 trillion rupiah, with the highest increase recorded in the electricity subsidy and energy compensation budget. This budget increase, higher than the assumption of currency exchange rate weakening, reflects the government's intention to maintain public purchasing power amidst a global economic slowdown outlook in 2025. Meanwhile, the non-energy subsidy budget and its reserves also increased significantly (+36%), one factor being the addition of the fertilizer subsidy quota from 6-7 million tons to 9 million tons in 2025. - Update on Sweetened Packaged Beverage (MBDK) Excise Duty and Tobacco Product Excise Duty (CHT): The government targets excise revenue in 2025 to increase by +6% to 244 trillion rupiah, partly through limited extension of excise duty on MBDK. The MBDK excise collection itself is targeted to reach 4.4 trillion rupiah in the 2024 APBN, but to date, this excise collection has not been implemented because the government has not yet issued the technical rules. Quantitatively, the estimated negative impact of MBDK excise on the profitability of consumer companies can only be calculated after the government releases the technical regulations for excise calculation. However, qualitatively, we assess that the negative impact of this excise can be minimized because: 1) companies can launch similar less-sugar products; and 2) companies can pass on part of the excise burden into product selling prices. We assess that Mayora Indah ($MYOR) - which has products exposed to MBDK excise amounting to 25-30% of total revenue - potentially feels the biggest impact from the implementation of this excise, followed by Industri Jamu dan Farmasi Sido Muncul ($SIDO) which has an exposure of around 15-20% of revenue. Meanwhile, the government explained that the customs and excise revenue target in the medium term (2025-2029) will be greatly influenced by the tobacco product excise duty (CHT) policy through moderate multiyear tariffs with simplification of tobacco product layers. These two factors were not previously mentioned in the 2024 RAPBN financial notes. - Indication of Free Nutritious Meal Budget ~Rp10,000 per Child per Day: The government confirmed that the budget for the free nutritious meal program has been included in the 2025 RAPBN with a value reaching 71 trillion rupiah, as previously reported. In the initial stage, the recipients of the free nutritious meal program are targeted to reach ~20 million students in underdeveloped areas and areas that already have facility readiness to implement the program. By calculating an initial capex of ~20 trillion rupiah, the free nutritious meal program budget implies an expenditure of ~10,000 thousand rupiah per child per day, according to our calculation. The government estimates that this program will add +0.1 percentage point to 2025 economic growth. - IKN Budget Only Rp143 M (vs. 2024: Rp43 T), but Still Baseline: The Minister of Finance, Sri Mulyani, said that several programs still have relatively small budgets in this transition RAPBN, including for IKN. However, this budget is still a baseline figure that can be added by the next government.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: In today's trading, Monday (19/8), cigarette manufacturer stocks closed significantly up - with $HMSP (+15.79%), $GGRM (+8.18%), and $WIIM (+8.79%) - potentially due to expectations of a more friendly excise policy. Meanwhile, from the government aspect, the next important development to watch is the new cabinet composition after the inauguration of the president and vice president on October 20, 2024.

marketNews.title: Gold Price Record and China's Coal Production Update
marketNews.content: Gold price rose +2.04% to the level of 2,507.28 US dollars per troy ounce on Friday (16/8) night, marking a historic record high price. The strengthening of gold prices occurred along with the weakening of the US dollar index (DXY) by -0.57% on the same day, driven by increasing expectations of the Fed's interest rate cuts and concerns over the escalation of geopolitical conflicts in the Middle East and Ukraine. China's national statistics bureau reported that China's coal production in July 2024 grew by +2.8% YoY to 390.37 million tons. Meanwhile, thermal power generation output - which largely uses coal - fell by -4.9% YoY in July 2024 to 574.9 billion kWh, marking a year-on-year decline for 3 consecutive months despite an overall rise in energy consumption. Reuters reported that this result potentially leads to lower import volumes and cheaper prices.

marketNews.title: Cabinet Reshuffle and Oil Lifting Focus for Remaining Term
marketNews.content: President Joko Widodo inaugurated several ministers and deputy ministers in a cabinet reshuffle on Monday (19/8). Bahlil Lahadalia was appointed as the Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources (ESDM) replacing Arifin Tasrif, who was previously nominated by PDIP. Bahlil's former position as the Minister of Investment/Head of the Investment Coordinating Board (BKPM) was replaced by Rosan Roeslani. President Joko Widodo also appointed Gerindra Party politician, Supratman Andi Agtas, as the Minister of Law and Human Rights to replace PDIP politician, Yasonna Laoly. Additionally, President Joko Widodo appointed Gerindra Party politician and Prabowo-Gibran campaign media director in the 2024 election, Angga Raka Prabowo, as Deputy Minister of Communication and Informatics. The Minister of ESDM, Bahlil Lahadalia, stated that he is committed to focusing on increasing oil lifting during his remaining two months in office, until October 2024. The realization of crude oil lifting during 1H24 only reached 576,000 barrels per day, equivalent to only 91% of the 2024 APBN target of 635,000 barrels per day. In the 2025 RAPBN, oil lifting is targeted to reach only 600,000 barrels per day. The Ministry of Finance noted that the government debt position as of the end of July 2024 reached 8,502.69 trillion rupiah, an increase of 57.82 trillion or 0.68% compared to the position at the end of June 2024. Nevertheless, the government debt ratio to gross domestic product (GDP) decreased from 39.13% at the end of June 2024 to 38.68% at the end of July 2024. President Joko Widodo inaugurated Dadan Hindayana as the Head of the National Nutrition Agency. This agency was formed to implement the free nutritious meal program campaigned by the elected president, Prabowo Subianto, which is scheduled to start on January 2, 2025. Dadan is a lecturer at the Faculty of Agriculture, Bogor Agricultural University. The Secretary-General of the National Awakening Party (PKB), Hasanuddin Wahid, stated that his party is joining the Advanced Indonesia Coalition in the 2024 Jakarta gubernatorial election. This coalition, consisting of 12 parties, officially declared Ridwan Kamil and Prosperous Justice Party (PKS) politician, Suswono, as candidates for Governor and Deputy Governor of Jakarta on Monday (19/8).

tickerNews.title: Bank Maybank Indonesia (BNII) Rumored to Plan Acquisition of JMAS
tickerNews.content: $JMAS: Kontan reported that Bank Maybank Indonesia ($BNII) is in talks to acquire 60% of the shares of Asuransi Jiwa Syariah Jasa Mitra Abadi. Kontan's source also mentioned that the controller of JMAS, Koperasi Simpan Pinjam Jasa, with an ownership stake of ~58%, opened a valuation price for 100% of JMAS shares at 200 billion rupiah, while BNII bid in the range of 100-150 billion rupiah. Responding to this news, the President Director of BNII, Steffano Ridwan, stated that his party has no acquisition plans. Meanwhile, the President Director of JMAS, Basuki Agus, mentioned that there are several parties interested in the company, but he leaves the decision to the shareholders.

tickerNews.title: Chandra Asri Pacific (TPIA) Confirms Exploring Potential IPO for Subsidiary PT Chandra Daya Investasi
tickerNews.content: $TPIA: In an information disclosure to the IDX, Chandra Asri Pacific confirmed that the company has begun exploring the possibility of an IPO plan for PT Chandra Daya Investasi, a subsidiary engaged in infrastructure. Nevertheless, this plan is still in the internal discussion stage. Previously, the Director of Chandra Asri Pacific, Suryandi, stated in early August 2024 that TPIA was opening the opportunity to bring PT Chandra Daya Investasi to become a public company.

tickerNews.title: PT Perusahaan Gas Negara (PGAS) Sales Volume and Transmission Volume for 7M24
tickerNews.content: $PGAS: Perusahaan Gas Negara recorded a gas sales volume of 847 BBTUD (-9% YoY) during 7M24, which is 11% lower than the management's 2024 target. Of this amount, 55% was contributed by HGBT users, while the remainder came from non-HGBT users. Meanwhile, gas transmission volume reached 1,490 MMSCFD (+4% YoY) during 7M24, 2% lower than the management's 2024 target. The LNG sales volume reached 43 BBTUD (+100% YoY) during 7M24, 66% lower than the management's 2024 target.

tickerNews.title: PT APP Purinusa Ekapersada Increased Ownership in Indah Kiat Pulp & Paper (INKP) Post-Transaction
tickerNews.content: $INKP: The controller of Indah Kiat Pulp & Paper, PT APP Purinusa Ekapersada, purchased 30 million INKP shares at a price of 9,000 rupiah per share on August 14, 2024. The transaction value reached 270 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the ownership of PT APP Purinusa Ekapersada in INKP increased from 56.57% to 57.12%.

tickerNews.title: PT Elnusa (ELSA) Completed Chemical Enhanced Oil Recovery (EOR) Studies and Targets Project Go-Live in 2024
tickerNews.content: $ELSA: The President Director of Elnusa, Bachtiar Soeria Atmadja, stated that his party has completed chemical enhanced oil recovery (EOR) studies in 10 work area structures belonging to PT Pertamina Hulu Energi and 1 structure in a gas block belonging to another company. Bachtiar stated that ELSA targets at least 1 chemical EOR project to go live in 2024 with an extended simulation scheme. Previously, at the end of 2023, ELSA signed a memorandum of understanding with the Chinese company, Daqing Oilfield Company Ltd., for the development of chemical EOR.

tickerNews.title: Kalbe Farma (KLBF) Subsidiary Begins Groundbreaking for Radioisotope and Radiopharmaceutical Production Facility in Surabaya
tickerNews.content: $KLBF: Kalbe Farma through its subsidiary, PT Global Onkolab Farma, inaugurated the groundbreaking for the construction of a radioisotope and radiopharmaceutical production facility in Surabaya. The factory will produce fluorodeoxyglucose (FGD) for early detection of cancer and will serve the needs of hospitals in East Java. This is the second radioisotope and radiopharmaceutical production facility built by KLBF, following the groundbreaking for a similar facility in Jakarta which began in early February 2024. The President Director of KLBF at that time, Vidjongtius, told Bisnis that 1 unit of radioisotope and radiopharmaceutical production facility costs 150-200 billion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: Ram Jethmal Punjabi Decreased Ownership in Tripar Multivision Plus (RAAM) After Share Sale
tickerNews.content: $RAAM: The controller of Tripar Multivision Plus, Ram Jethmal Punjabi, sold approximately 365.2 million RAAM shares at a price of 497 rupiah per share on August 12-15, 2024. The transaction value reached 181.3 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the ownership of Ram Jethmal Punjabi in RAAM decreased from 83.23% to 77.33%.

tickerNews.title: Elang Mahkota Teknologi (EMTK) Increased Ownership in Sarana Meditama Metropolitan (SAME)
tickerNews.content: The controller of Sarana Meditama Metropolitan ($SAME), Elang Mahkota Teknologi ($EMTK), purchased 35.2 million SAME shares at an average price of 290 rupiah per share between February 15 and August 14, 2024. The total transaction value reached 10.3 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the ownership of EMTK in SAME increased from 78.18% to 78.38%.
